quote.quotepara: ... I tried installing a newer version of the kernel (2.2.16). The old kernel (2.2.14-5.0) automatically turns off the power at the end of a shutdown. I can't seem to configure the new kernel to do the same. What am I missing?
I've installed RH7.0, with the 2.4.2 kernel. It still doesn't turn off the power when I shut it down from the X login screen. I can get it to turn off the power if I run poweroff as root.
How can I get the X shutdown process to run poweroff?

body.para: If you're running "kernel secure", it *will* do
that (i.e. only allow root to shut off the power). If you use the
regular kernel, then anyond can call a shutdown, and the system will
